txt.en: Gapi is at Anazârmekhem, south of Budkhul-tharâk.\n\nGapi will be pleased to hear the bonfires have all been lit.

'I have set up all the campfires, and now it is time to light them. It will be as if a massive snake of flame is slithering towards Mazog's forces in Khazad-dûm. He will feel the fear.\n\n'Go north, into Mazog's territory, up the stairs and to Budkhul-tharâk. You will find the bonfires ready to be lit. Set them ablaze, and then our final blow will come.'
'The bonfires are lit, and we have already reaped some of the benefits of our plan.\n\n'Mazog has assembled a southern post to watch the Ghâsh-hai. That is where we will strike next.'
'The bonfires must be lit for Mazog to fall for the ruse.'
The dwarves are attempting to frighten Mazog into believing the Ghâsh-hai are preparing an assault against Khazad-dûm.
Light the bonfires in Budkhul-tharâk to the north of Anazârmekhem.\n\nThe bonfires leading into Khazad-dûm are ready to be lit.
